column1: allasha 157475192306 "2017-02-20 07:11:05 GMT" https://allasha.tumblr.com/post/157475192306/donnie-yen-is-cool-but-his-mother-is-much-cooler "fuckyeahwomen:  Born in Guangzhou
column2: China
column3: Bow-sim Mark started seriously training in Wushu during high school
column4: specializing in Tai Chi and Northern Shaolin. At the time
column5: women who studied martial arts were almost unheard of. However
column6: her talents caught the attention of the Great Grandmaster Fu Wing Way
column7: one of the most decorated martial artists in China and founder of Fu Style Tai Chi. He ended up taking her in as his private student. In 1984
column8: Mark won a gold medal at the first International Tournament of Tâ€™ai chi châ€™uan in Wuhan City. In 1995
column9: she was named Black Belt magazineâ€™s Kung-Fu artist of the year. Before Mark immigrated to the U.S.
column10: she was already famous all over China not just because she was a talented female martial artist
column11: but because she was also better than most men in her craft. â€œEverything is harder for a woman
column12: â€ Mark told NextShark with some help in translating from her daughter Chris Yen. Â â€œIf a man has to work at 100% to excel
column13: a woman must work at 150%! Not just in martial arts but in any field in order to be taken seriously.â€ Mark with Donnie Yen and his sister
column14: Chris Yen.After teaching at her masterâ€™s school for 10 years
column16: Massachusetts in 1975 where she became one of the first people to introduce Wushu to the West. â€œThere were only a few Chinese kung-fu schools in Chinatown and mostly karate schools around the suburbs
column17: â€ Mark said. â€œMy school was the first Chinese â€˜Wushuâ€™ school and at the time
column18: Wushu was not known yet in the West.â€ As a successful martial arts master whoâ€™s had students open up schools themselves
column19: Sifu Mark broke down what makes a good teacher. She notes that while there are many styles of Tai Chi
column20: all tai chi can be judged by six characteristics and six requirements: â€œThe characteristics are that the movement should be circular
column24: and done with intent and energy. The requirements are that the spine is naturally straight
column25: the shoulders and elbows are sunk
column27: the movement originates in the waist
column28: the pelvis is at a natural angle
column29: and yin and yang are clear.â€ Watch an interview with Bow-sim Mark here. " False link
